ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Name of the PHP Class of this pager.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: pagerClassName = Tx_PtExtlist_Domain_Model_Pager_DefaultPager

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Name of the template class for this pager.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: templatePath = EXT:pt_extlist/Resources/Private/Templates/Pager/Default.html

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Indicates if this pager is enabled.
Indicates if the firstLink is shown.
Indicates if the previousLink is shown.
Indicates if the firstLink is shown.
Indicates if the nextLink is shown.
The unique identifier of this filter.
The label which is displayed beside the filter.
An optional description string, that describes the filters functions.
The default value which is shown or selected by default.
Comma separated list of user groups wich have access to this filter.

WARNING: Which one to choose??? Identifier of a defined data field. The filter affects on this data field. If more than on fieldIdentifier is given, the resulting query is linked with or. Either a single identifier of a defined field, a comma separated list of identifiers or '*' to use all defined fields.
Name of the PHP Class of this filter.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: Tx_PtExtlist_Domain_Model_Filter_StringFilter

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Invert the constraint of this filter.
Show a controle to invert this filter.

A cObject definition to render every selct option. With {field:FIELDNAME} you can accedd all display Fields. Additional the implicit defined fields [allDisplayFields] for all defined displayFields and [rowCount] for the count of the entrys with this option are possible.
One or multiple identifiers of previously defined data fields.
ENTRY.DEFAULT: If not set, the field defined in fieldIdentifier is used.

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: List of filters that are not considered for the group query of this filter.
ENTRY.DATATYPE: String / Comma separated list of filterIdentifiers.

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION:
Show the row count if the select filter is filled with grouped data.
Info for use with MySQL Backend In case this list is grouped by any field, showRowCount also implies the following manipulation to the original list query: 1. ShowRowCount is activated, In this case we have to build the list first and then use this list as source to calculate the selectable rows and the count. This has the drawback, that options are not displayed, if grouped within the list. 2. ShowRowCount is not activated: In this case, we exchange the original grouping fields with the fields needed by the filter.
Instant submit filter if a value is selected.
If a default value for a filter is set in TypoScript, the filter will be set to this value if it is resetted. If this is set to 0, the filter will be resetted to an empty value.
Label of an option that is added to the select list. If this option is selected, the filter is inactive.
The submitted value for the inactiveOption described above.
Defines the string that is shown as breadcrumb for the filter. You can use '%v' for the filter's value and '%l' for the filter's label.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: breadCrumbString = %l equals '%v'

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Hide the filter completely from the filterBox (don't render any output). This can be used in filters like the proxy filter or any filter that is only set via the extlistContext PHP methods.
Defines explicit options to display in a data filter. If options are set, no data is fetched from the database. There are to variants to define the data. See the example for details.
Main TS-key for all pt_extlist settings.
Holds configuration for all list identifiers configured by array key.
Basic settings for pt_extlist

Define the session storage adapter that should be used in uncached mode. Posible values are the classes described below or any other class that implements the interface Tx_PtExtbase_State_Session_Storage_AdapterInterface.
ENTRY.POSIBLEVALUES: Tx_PtExtbase_State_Session_Storage_SessionAdapter: Default browser session storage adapter. Tx_PtExtbase_State_Session_Storage_FeUserSessionAdapter: TYPO3 fe_user bases session storage.

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Define the session storage adapter that should be used in cached mode. Posible values are the classes described below or any other class that implements the interface Tx_PtExtbase_State_Session_Storage_AdapterInterface.
ENTRY.POSIBLEVALUES: Tx_PtExtlist_Domain_StateAdapter_Storage_NullStorageAdapter: Hold every session variable as GET parameters in the URL. Use this adapter if you want to use realURL. Tx_PtExtlist_Domain_StateAdapter_Storage_DBStorageAdapter: Save the session variables into the database and add an identifier for this db-entry to the GET variables. Use this adapter if you want to handle many parameters and keep the URL length constant.

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: By setting this to "1", a list will be reset if there is no GP-Vars-Data for current request. You can use this, if you want a list to be in its default state every time you open the page on which the list is inserted.
Holds configuration for a single list identifier. This is where the main part of your list configuration has to be set up.
List default values.
The default sorting column while no other sorting ist set. Direction can be set with DESC or ASC after the column identifier.
Set to 1 if you want to cache rendering of cells. Can slow down list creation, if values are all different and caching makes no sense.

If set to 1 the iterationListData is used instead of the default listData. While the listData provides an array of all data fetched from the database, which is then mapped and rendered completely, the iterationListData fetches, maps and renders a single row at a time. This has the big advantage, that only the memory for a single row object is consumed and only a constant amount of memory is needed, independent from the amoutn of rows. The disadvantage is, that a renderer is only able to process one single row, which makes it impossible to compute an aggregate on the fetched data.
Holds the configuration for the data backend to be used with this configuration. Configurable values depend on individual backend, e.g. TYPO3-Backend, MySQL-Backen, ExtBase-Backend etc.
Backend configuration for connecting to native MySQL databases. DSN needs to be configured.
Defines datasource for (MySQL) data backend.
Defines hostname of mysql database server.
ENTRY.POSIBLEVALUES: All valid addresses for servers (IP-Addresses and URLs)

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Port number on which MySQL database server is listening.
Name of database to be used for connection.
Username to be used for database connection.
Password to be used for database connection.
Holds the FROM clause of a mysql query without the FROM keyword.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: static_countries LEFT JOIN static_territories AS st_subcontinent ON (static_countries.cn_parent_tr_iso_nr = st_subcontinent.tr_iso_nr)

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Holds the WHERE clause of a mysql query without the WHERE keyword.
Holds the GROUP BY clause of a mysql query without the GROUP BY keyword.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: st_continent

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: TYPO3 Backend. Inherits the Features from the MySql Backend but the datasource is already configured. The TYPO3 Backend handles enableFields automatically in where clauses.
Define tables to be used with enable fields. TYPO3 special fields (deleted, hidden) are automatically applied to query.
ENTRY.DATATYPE: Comma seperated list of table names and aliases (optional).
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: static_countries, static_territories st_continent

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Use enableFields for alle tables that are defined with key tables.
Extbase Repository Backend.

If this is set to 1, a list will be reset every time there is no GP-var data for current request. You can use this switch, if you want a list to be reset to its default settings every time you open up a page.
Defines raw datasource fields, wich can than combined and processed in to table fields.
Named definition of a single data field.
The table, this field belongs to.
Name of the tables field.
Insert a individual SQL snippet.
Configures if the list can be sorted by the column.
Configures if this column is visible by default. The visibility can be toggled by the columnSelector.
Use this to implode and later split the rows. This Separator should never be part of the selected string!
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: expandGroupRowsSeparator = SomeStringThatNeverOccursInAnyOfTheSelectedFields

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Holds the tables column definitions.
Either a single identifier of a defined field, a comma separated list of identifiers or '*' to use all defined fields.
A label for this element.
A list of userfunctions to render the field value.

Define sorting for this column. A single sorting definition consists either of a fieldidentifier or a fieldidentifier followed by direction. The direction can be fixed with adding a '!' in front of the direction. Settings in sorting are overwritten by sortingFields!
Define more sophisticated sorting for a column. Fields, directions, forced sorting and label can be defined individually. Settings in sortingsFields overwrite settings in sorting!
Field identifier to set up sorting for.
Label to be displayed in column header.
Direction is used if direction is forced or if column is default sorting column.
If set to 1, this field is always sorted using direction set above.
Image for ascending ordered column header.
Image for descending ordered column header.
Image for unordered column header.
If rawfields is set to 1, the default renderer sets an array of all fields as the value of the column instead of a comma separated list. This array can the now be used in a custom list template.
Set CSS class used for th-tag in list header.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: headerThCssClass = yourCssClass

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Set to 1 if you want to cache rendering of cells. Can slow down list creation, if values are all different and caching makes no sense.
Configuration for the column selector widget.
Per default the column selector is disabled. You have to enable the selector to avoid illicit unhiding of columns.
If set to 1, the selector only shows the columns, that are set to visible in the column configuration. If set to 0, all columns are selectable.

Persist the selected columns to session. If the CS is used only to select the columns for printView, it should not persist its state to session permanently because this would effect the original list also.
If enabled, only selected columns are shown in the list. When disabled, the selected columns are added to already visible columns.
Set the partial path
Holds the renderer configuration.

A list of chained renderer classes that work on list data structures. The default renderer class uses the column configuration, to render the list of field data in a list of rows and columns. By default this renderer iscalled at position 100. All defined renderer before 100 work on a field data list, while renderer after 100 work on a column list data structure.
Configuration of a single renderer.
The class name of the renderers php class.
Defines aggregates of data fields.
Named definition of a single data field.
Defined aggregate methods.
The scope for the aggregation can be either set to the current page or to the whole query. Aggregates for the current page are calculated internally without an additonal database query.
Holds the aggregates columns definitions.
Holds all pager configuration
Sets the items per page. A value of 0 means to show all entrys.
Holds an array of all defined pagers
Identifier of a pager
Configuration for default pager
Configuration for delta pager. Shows only a configured amount of pagenumbers around the current page.
Configuration for minimal pager. Shows only Forward and backward links without the page numbers.
Holds all filterbox configurations.
Show a reset link for all filters of this filterBox.
Show a submit button for this filterBox.

If this is set to a PID or page identifier, the form for this filterbox is directly submitted to this page. This can be helpful, if you do not need a validation of filter, as we don't need a redirect then (faster response times).

Redirects to given page id, controller and action if filter submits. Does not redirect if filter does not validate. You always have to set an action and a controller, if you want to redirect to another page only! Use fake names, if there are no controllers / actions you can addresse.
Id of page that you want to redirect to, after filterbox submits (and validates").
Name of controller that sould be called after filterbox submits (and validates!).
Name of action that should be called on destination page after filterbod submits (and validates).

Given filters are excluded from filtering of this filterbox. If filters are set here, they are not respected, if this filterbox is submitted. Don't mix up this setting with filter.excludeFilters setting!
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: excludeFilters = filterbox1.filterIdentifier1, filterbox2.filterIdentifier1

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Holds the configuration of the filters of this filter box.
Define the size of the string field.
Define the maximum length of the string field.
Shows a string filter.
If set to 1 the filter queries the field by key="value" instead of key like "%value%"
If set to any value, the filterValue is separated at this token, and the single pieces are combined with SQL OR. To separate at a blank, use pipes to define it (orToken = | |).
ENTRY.EXAMPLE:
Typoscript:
10 { orToken = ||| andToken = & }
Search String: test Generated SQL: table1.field1 LIKE "%test%"
Search String: test | test2 & test3 Generated SQL: (table1.field1 LIKE "%test%") OR ((table1.field1 LIKE "%test2%") AND (table1.field1 LIKE "%test3%"))

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: If set to any value, the filterValue is separated at this token, and the single pieces are combined with SQL AND. To separate at a blank, use pipes to define it (orToken = | |).
Shows a filter to do a fullText query. The execution is database specific. If you are using a MySQL database, you have to add a fullText index to the relevant fields first.

The minimum word length, depends on databackend/backend server configuration. The default configuration for mysql servers is a minimum length of 4. Adjust this value to the according configuration of your server to get a error message if the length of the provided search word is below the this value.
This is a MySQL specific value. If it is set to 1, the query is executed in boolean mode.

If the parameter booleanMode is set to 1 and booleanModeWrapWithStars is set to 1 the searchWord is wrapped with stars (if not already done by the user). The effect is, that matches in substrings are also posible.
ClassName of a dataProvider class that delivers options to select.
This data provider allows you to execute a separate query to fetch the options.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: # Example 1 selectFilter < plugin.tx_ptextlist.prototype.filter.select { partialPath = Filter/Options/SelectFilter filterClassName = Tx_PtExtlist_Domain_Model_Filter_SelectFilter dataProviderClassName = Tx_PtExtlist_Domain_Model_Filter_DataProvider_ExplicitSQLQuery optionsSqlQuery { select = cn_short_local from = static_countries where = delete = 0 orderBy = groupBy = limit = } }

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: The SELECT part of the query.
The FROM part of the query.
The WHERE part of the query.
The ORDER BY part of the query.
The GROUP BY part of the query.
The LIMIT part of the query.
This data provider allows you to define options for a select filter.
A key/value list of options
Renders a filter with buttons.
Comma separated list of letters that have to be in the selection even if no data with this letter was found in the query.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: addLettersIfMissing = A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,N,M,O,P,Q,R,S,T,U,V.W,X,Y,Z

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Renders a list of date definitions like "August 2011" to select entries in a given file range.

The fieldIdentifier for a timeSpanFilter (every filter that derives from the abstractTimeSpanFilter) can be set by two different ways. 1. by a comma seperated list of fieldIdentifer as normal. 2. by defining a 2-dimensional list of start and end fields that determines the start and end of an event. See the example for details.
This filter requires a start and an end value as default.
The filter converts the the time values to the format defined with dbTimeFormat.
ENTRY.POSIBLEVALUES: For MySql the possible Values are: UnixTimesTamp (Integer): U DATETIME: Y-m-d H:i:s DATE: Y-m-d TIMESTAMP: Y-m-d H:i:s TIME: H:i:s YEAR: Y
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: dbTimeFormat = U

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Used for dateIterator dataProvider. Start date in unix timestamp format.
Used for dateIterator dataProvider. End date in unix timestamp format.
The step size to increment the dates.
ENTRY.POSIBLEVALUES: 'h': by hour 'i': by minute 's': by second 'd': by day 'm': by month 'y': by year
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: dateIteratorIncrement = m

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: How the labels for the timeSpan is rendered. You hav to use PHP strftime format to render labels in the according language.
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: dateIteratorFormat = %m.%Y

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Maximum of items to show.
Minimum Color
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: minColor = #1c448d

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Maximum Color
ENTRY.EXAMPLE: maxColor = #b8cffa

ENTRY.DESCRIPTION: Minimum size of tags in pixel.
Maximum size of tags in pixel
A proxy filter is not displayed. It uses a filter from an other list defined by the proxy path and sets the result constraint to the given field.
Path to a filter from an other list. The path has the format [listId].[filterBoxId].[filterId]
Path to the header partial.
Path to the body partial.
Path to the aggregate row partial.
Export configuration templates for different export types.
Export configuration section.
Export configuration templates for different export types.
Export the list as CSV.
Sets the column delimiter.
Sets the output encoding.
Export the listData in any representation defined by fluid syntax.
Excel export
Remove HTML Tags from content.

Use the cell style configuration from the column configuration to style the body part of the list. This tremendously decreases the render performance. Therefore it is not suitable for big lists > 10k lines.
Render a block with the filter states of the list to the table header.
If set, render this free text to the head of the list.
Uses the domPdf library to export the list data as pdf document.
Path to the domPDF Sources.
